headline: Basic Cream Cheese Frosting
description: This cream cheese frosting uses butter, cream cheese, confectioners' sugar, and vanilla to make a sweet and delicious topping for cakes and cupcakes.

video.description: Perfect frosting for your next baking creation!
video.name: Basic Cream Cheese Frosting

name: Basic Cream Cheese Frosting

recipeInstructions.text: Beat cream cheese, softened butter, and vanilla together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and creamy.
Gradually beat in confectioners' sugar until smooth.

review.reviewBody: I have made this recipe many times, exactly as written. It is always delicious and I get compliments when I ice my spice cakes and carrot cakes with it. It is my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù recipe!
Good taste, Easy to make. Must refrigerate cake, cups after icing immediately or it will start to run.
Excellent as is. I start with 2 cups confectioners' sugar and increase amount gradually. Worked perfectly with decorator bags and tips.
Very good icing. It will be my go-to here on out.
Classic, tried and true. Also great on pumpkin muffins and cinnamon rolls!! Good recipe to have in your file

I have made this cake several times. There is a perfect balance of flavors with the carrots, raisins, and pineapple. It is so moist! For those of you who are making this for the first time don't be scared to add the small amount of liquid that you get after mixing the brown sugar and shredded carrots. Enjoy!
Great recipe. I added cinnamon as I used it on a spice cake.. Delicious

Loved it just the way it was! But I double the recipe and I add a 1/3 cup of Eagle Brand condensed milk, when I bake cakes I normally make 2 three 8 inch layered cakes because every one always wants TO GO cake! Highly recommended!!! Thank you, Kay Lee
taste was good consistency was way off kept running off cake
I am not a cook, but I found this recipe very simple to make. It tasted great with the carrot cake muffins I made.
loved it!!
I added 3 more oz of cream cheese. It is delicious!
I'm making this tonight. Not sure maybe top a cake with it. Looks do easy and delicious. Thank you for sharing
It is absolutely gorgeous just the look of it, I just want to look at it in the bowl. Lol I'm crazy for it!!!
Tastes very good! I was very nervous sense the recipe was uh, simple. Too simple. But just a tip, don't add in your sugar all at once... My mixer started smoking....
So rich and yummy and creamy
Delicious!! Just a heads up for others that make this recipe, I made 12 servings of this for 24 cupcakes, and had extra icing.
It I now my go too for everything. Bread pudding, Cinnabon clones, puffs... I love it. My family approves too.

I used 16 oz of cream cheese and it came out with the perfect balance of cream cheese and sweetness. 100% would recommend with a 2c powdered sugar= 8oz cream cheese (I used food coloring on my frosting üòÅ)
So good made it on red velvet cupcakes and ate at least a cup of it

eehh, It was not bad, just a matter of my own personal taste preference. Everyone loved it on red velvet cupcakes. I personally like a tangy type cream cheese icing. Thought I'd try it, it is good though. Everyone has their own taste preferences.
Simple as can be with plenty of flavor.
Oh my good goody good!!! I only used two and one half cups of sugar because I love the taste of cream cheese. Husband loves this frosting!! Definite winner!!!

Great recipe cut it in half 
Added extra vanilla
Good
This frosting was just my Brandied Fruit Cake needed. The cream cheese complimented the Brandied fruit. A great recipe, thanks for sharing ‚Ä¶..

Good stuff! I started with 3 cups of powdered sugar as I like desserts on the less-sweet side. I will probably start with 2 cups sugar and a bit less butter next time, but that isn't to fault the recipe. As a frosting for cinnamon rolls, this works great.

Amazing! I don‚Äôt have a mixer, so I put all ingredients in a ziploc bag, I microwaved the butter for 20 seconds, then added the cream cheese to the bowl and microwaved another 20 seconds because I‚Äôm impatient and didn‚Äôt want to wait for it to get to room temperature. I then mixed the butter and cream cheese a bit and added the vanilla, then while it was still lumpy I put it in the ziploc bag that held the sugar and squeezed all the lumps out and squeezed until it was mixed, it was runny and yellow, so I added a 5th cup of confectionary sugar and squeezed some more. It was the consistency of playdoh, nice and soft, I then snipped off the end of the ziploc bag and squeezed it onto my Duncan Hines dark chocolate fudge cake that was cooled. 
Wow! It tasted just like Entenmann‚Äôs chocolate marshmallow cake! 
It piped out of the bag smoothly and looked amazing! Really held its shape. As for the sweetness, I don‚Äôt like things too sweet and for some reason this wasn‚Äôt too sweet, it actually complemented the cake perfectly! 
I crumbled some cake on the top and bought an Entenmann‚Äôs chocolate marshmallow cake and compared the two with my friends, they all said they were the same cake!

I have made this recipe several times and love it. The recipe says "serves 12" so I did 1.5x recipe to frost 20 cupcakes and was worried I wouldn't have enough but I had plenty. I also always add the powdered sugar 1 cup at a time and generally end up adding less than the recipe call for. I'm sure that makes it softer and a little harder to work with (although still able to be piped), but my family and I like it less sweet. This one is a keeper!
I made the frosting as directed and it is fluffy and delicious! I frosted the Easy Pumpkin Bars with it.

I made this cream frosting with a few modifications. First added almond extract (ratio I used was half of the vanilla), which I quadrupled the recipe, and then I added the powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and almond extract incrementally until flavor were perfect to me. It came out amazing. My son said he'd eat that on bagels and other stuff. It reminded both of us of the cheese in cheese danishes.
This is perfect for cakes and cupcakes. It is not too sweet and compliments the flavor of the cake you use it on. The consistency is thicker too so it is easy to work with.
Reduced powered sugar by 1/2 c. Added 1/2c cocoa powder for Chocolate Cream Frosting. Mmmm,Mmmm Good!

It was great. Perfect on the cinnamon rolls I made it for. Not to sweet but creamy and smooth
Love it.
I made a pumpkin spice cake and used it for the icing on the top. It was delicious!
Too sweet for my taste, personally. I'm not a sweets type person. BUT my kids loved it. The flavor is great and classic. This is excellent and easy to make.
I halved the recipe, and only used one cup of sugar, and it‚Äôs still a little too sweet for what I expected. Family all agrees with me. Otherwise good and very easy though!
I've made it before but this time I made just as it said . Perfect! So good with my triple fudge brownies
Oh, my goodness! So easy, so rich, so yummy. Just the right amount of bite (I don't like super sweet frostings).
I didn‚Äôt really need this much frosting for a 9x13 cake but since I used a boxed cake mix, i was happy to let the frosting have the glory. Wow, this stuff is really good!
Awesome. I roughly halved it and even without real measurements it turned out great.
I agree with others it‚Äôs a classic yummy cream cheese recipe. I always add less sugar, but that‚Äôs just it my family‚Äôs taste.
Used only 2 cups sugar.
This recipe worked out great! Wonderful taste and consistency. I put it on a 13x9 carrot cake and there was plenty left over to eat.
Amazing! I made it with some strawberry filling and it was flawless!!!

Followed the recipe exactly, using the full 4 cups of powdered sugar. Used half of it to frost one dozen cupcakes, then added 3 T of Ghirardelli unsweetened cocoa powder to make some chocolate frosting for the other dozen. Family loved them at Easter.
Delicious! 3 1/2 cups sifted powdered sugar was perfect.
Yummy! Holds its shape when piped.
I wanted chocolate so added a little cocoa, It needed liquid, so I added a little chocolate milk as well. I did not use all the sugar the recipe called for.
Yummy!

Basic pantry ingredients and able to up in no time! Made chocolate cupcakes for dessert for an impromptu dinner for my son & his family. Easily made this frosting with my 9-year old granddaughter, and had plenty for 18 cupcakes!
True and easy cream cheese icing. Fabulous!
This recipe is great - I added some salt as well which just increased the flavour that much more.
I accidentally used tablespoons of vanilla instead of teaspoons and it definitely altered the taste, lol. All in all....being that I've made this recipe before I'm reviewing on that and it's great!
I thought the consistency was too thick so, I added more cream cheese, 8 more ounces the consistency was point on after that.
It was simple and delicious!!
Made as written and turned out perfect

it wasnt the best nor the worst. the taste was amazing but I'm looking at some ratings and people are saying its too sweet. i only added one cup of confectioner sugar to it, so it was ok... but the chunks :/ I had to add milk to it to get rid of it, and even now, its still chunky. i think over all besides that, its ok.
Great recipe!! I used lemon extract instead. I LOVE cream cheese frosting but hubby doesn't! With the lemon extract, he said it was really good and ate all the frosting on the cake I made.
Perfect!!
I made this for some cinnamon rolls. I added a little more vanilla and a bit of lemon extract for that bit of tang, and it was quite good.

This was absolutely delicious!! I added a pinch of salt, about a tablespoon of coffee mate creamer and left out about three quarter of a cup of the powdered sugar, otherwise it would have been too sweet. I frosted a banana cake with this. Simply amazing!
Not too sweet, and a good cream cheese flavor! I made it exactly as written, and it's a great basic cream cheese icing!
it was easy and i enjoyed myself thank you

I like this recipe, and I've used it for sometime now. If you find it too sweet, add a tablespoon or, two of flour, one at a time. An icing trick, my Mother taught me, years and years ago. You'd never know there was a bit of flour in it.
Love it. But I only use 2 cups of sugar though. 4 cups will be too sweet for me. Thank you for the recipe.
So easy and really really good!
Love the taste, it is sweet, but has the perfect cream cheese balance and perfect consistency.
Smooth and creamy!
I used about 3 cups of sugar. It was delicious and very well received!
Yum!!! This is so good!! I put it on my pumpkin loaf . It could be used on any cake or cookie or loaf. So easy & so tasty
I've made this frosting more times then I can count, my husband & kids luv it!
this was very easy to do, and very good. I will come back to this one for sure..
This is a very good recipe. The flavor and consistency was just right!. I omitted the milk, and it spread
It worked perfectly! It was a big hit, I topped my pumpkin bread with it.
It was an okay recipe but the butter overpowered it and I had to had about 6 oz of cream cheese on top of what it asked for and to make the cream cheese stand out more!!!
Easy and tasty!
Used this for my carrot cake and absolutely loved it!
It's just what you would expect. Simple and tasty. All you need is a bowl and a fork.
It was exactly what I wanted! I followed the directions other than I did not measure out 4 cups of confectioner's sugar, I just used a 16 oz box. Easy peasy!!
A bit too sweet for my taste. Sugar almost over powers the cream cheese goodness.
Good but I added more sugar.
This was very easy and quick to make, and my entire family absolutely loved it! I definitely recommend

This recipe worked perfectly for me! It wasn‚Äôt too complicated, and was still delicious. I added a dash of milk to thin it and help it to blend easier, and it was the perfect icing to top the carrot cake that I made. I‚Äôll definitely be using it again!
Very easy and delicious! My granddaughter loved it and asked for the recipe!!
Easy recipe, just added 1/2 t milk to make it more creamer
Quick, simple and delicious. Made a strawberry cake for my hubby for Father's Day... it's his Favorite!

I was making 2 sheet cakes so I doubled the recipe. The thickness was great - after I mixed 2 bags of Confectioners Sugar into the frosting because the butter was the foremost flavor. I had to get rid of that horrible butter taste.
It was delicious

I just made this for the first time and I knew right off the bat that the 4 cups of powdered sugar would be too much so I just did 2 cups. It's perfect!! I did have to add 1 teaspoon of milk just because I thought it was way too thick. Also since it didnt specify what kind of butter I used salted butter. It's still sweet, just perfect for our chocolate cake.
This frosting is delicious. My daughter always requests it for our cakes
It‚Äôs delicious and so easy! I did reduce the powdered sugar to about 2.5 cups because I ran out. It was so good!
Great taste but I Had cut the sugar in half And it turned out perfect.
Delicious! I used vanilla bean paste and 1 cup of sugar to reduce the sweetness.

I simply love cream cheese icing. One thing I do a lot, is I omit the butter and just use the cream cheese and when I want plain White icing, I omit the vanilla. I‚Äôve used different icings for different things for over 45 years now and this recipe is delicious the way it is. You can add different flavors like lemon, orange, strawberry coconut , cocoa chocolate , so many different ways to make different varieties of this and never loose the cream cheese flavor.
This is my go-to homemade frosting. My family loves it!
Used 3 cups of sugar instead of 4 to cut back sweetness and bring out cream cheese flavor.
Added some allspice into the frosting. Was good, but covered the cream cheese flavor a little.
Great & super easy. Can't ask for much more.
